prompt: A person walks on the underside of clouds looking down at the sky below them, gravity is inverted, birds fly upside down beneath their feet, the person's hair and clothes fall upward, afternoon sun shines from below. Surreal, M.C. Escher physics, shot on anamorphic lens with shallow DOF.

Rain falling upward into storm clouds, each droplet rises from a still lake surface and accelerates skyward, the lake becomes emptier, storm clouds above fill and darken, time flows backward. Shot in slow motion 240fps, Kodak Portra 400, moody blue-grey palette.

A grand piano suspended in the middle of the ocean, perfectly dry and playing itself, waves crash around it but never touch it, a single spotlight from an unknown source illuminates the piano, stars reflect in calm water around it. Cinematic, lonely, impossible. Shot at blue hour.

Doors opening into other doors endlessly, each threshold reveals another door in a different architectural style, baroque to brutalist to bamboo, the camera dollies forward through this infinite corridor, each door frame is a portal. Shot like Inception, anamorphic wide.

A staircase that spirals both up and down simultaneously creating a paradox, a figure walks it ascending and descending at the same time, the space folds in on itself, warm golden lighting from impossible angles. Penrose stairs, architectural impossibility, 35mm film aesthetic.
